dailysoundtracks.description: Please take a moment to enjoy this music video! This artist is wild and I am a huge fan. A quote from a commenter: 'she's like a witch who has spent an inordinate number of lifetimes studying the arcane arts and has forgotten what it's like to be human but woke up in a very good mood today'
Bossa nova bliss! No video game has nailed beach music as well as this. It's divine, and it's perfect.

dailysoundtracks.album: And In The Darkness, Hearts Aglow
dailysoundtracks.track: God Turn Me Into a Flower
dailysoundtracks.description: Beautiful, stunning song. Music reserved for when I'm feeling lost, devastated, wistful, broken after a major life change. The video makes me feel a lot of things.

dailysoundtracks.artist: Manaka Kataoka, Maasa Miyoshi, Masato Ohashi, Tsukasa Usui
dailysoundtracks.album: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom
dailysoundtracks.description: So much to love from this soundtrack, but this is my favourite. It's sparse but still has a lot going on. So pleasant to listen to
I love Norah Jones! This song however is very different from your normal Norah programming. It's a song about murdering Miriam

An English band I've followed since forever, I've enjoyed their folky music from all their albums. This is a deep cut which I love for its chill vibes. Feels like I'm at a pub hanging out with the band

I love Pikmin and this is the best music from all the games. It's a never-heard-before chord sequence over a dreamy 5/4 time signature experience. Close your eyes and enjoy the visuals as you listen to this track

Today's obscure-ass video game music comes from much-hated Fire Emblem Fates, a game that I love. It's from the later maps of the not-very-good Revelations route and it is so creepy and nice. A healthy 7/8 time signature helps too.
I'm a diehard fan of this guy and I will recommend many songs from him but here's a newer one which touched me. Nice video too
I love Michael Kiwanuka's albums but one of my favourite tracks (and videos!) is this special single track. It's rare! Take a moment to appreciate the video today, it's gorgeous.
Little Simz is so cool! She's my favourite rapper, and this video is great.
This soundtrack didn't have all that much to offer, but I loved this remix of Super Metroid's Lower Brinstar. It's peaceful but unsettling

I can't remember how I got into this album but it's a recreation (or maybe entirely new tracks?) for the old Kojima game Policenauts. I originally heard it in a Sheik combo video. It's full of Jazz fusion bangers!

When I first heard this track, I was transfixed. I sank into a deep obsession with this band and came to love this album and all their subsequent releases. What gender is the singer? Who knows. I don't know about the video but the music just hits so hard.
I just want it to be on record that this is my favourite hourly theme from Animal Crossing. I have many favourites but I think this is my true favourite.

dailysoundtracks.track: Ã‰ Preciso Dar um Jeito, Meu Amigo
dailysoundtracks.description: A groovy Brazilian rock song that kickstarted a lengthy journey into Brazilian music for me!
I love this band! They're local and based in Berlin and we saw them once and it was amazing. This track is giving lesbians in a spa vibes. The video is kinda uncomfortable though
Everyone talks about the Wii Shop Channel but nobody mentions the wealth of banger music they had on rotation for the Wii U and 3DS. This one is a personal favourite of mine.
I love this groovy track from the Nintendo DS. It's so catchy and fun.
Huge track from this great band. I love their classic house inspired pop. I've DJ'd this track many times. Also I'm obsessed with the singer she is so beautiful

dailysoundtracks.album: The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time
dailysoundtracks.description: A classic, ambient track from Ocarina of Time. It's unlikely that games have music like this in them. It's eerie and beautiful and I love it.
At the 1998 Grammys, Pavarotti was meant to come and sing his Nessum Dorma, but had a sore throat, so his mate Aretha jumps in for him and well, you just have to watch it for yourself.
I love Sade with all my heart. This song is about a man who killed someone at war, and how he wears his shame like a tattoo. It's devastating
A beautiful track that I used to love and adore. I just discovered this concert with her and an orchestra. It's gorgeous!
I really enjoy this groovy disco pop song. There's this one chord progression where he says 'start talking to people we don't even know' which makes me go OOH every time.

So difficult to select a track from this soundtrack because there are so many incredible ones. Here's a taste for the uninitiated: one of the battle songs! It's tango music with a bossa nova bit, and they called it mariachi. In the game you have to hit your opponents to the beat of the music, so the battle music was always a big deal.

The Melee remix of Kraid's Lair from Metroid goes so hard. I think this track alone turned on many hapless smash fans onto the majesty that is Metroid music. Taking the original NES bleeps and bloops and turning it into this, incredible. I love the beat drop halfway through.

Here's a gem from the Woolly World soundtrack. It plays in an auto-scroll level right before the final boss. You don't even get to hear the whole track during the level! But it's so hypnotic and beautiful and unlike any other kind of Bowser's Castle song.

The only video available is this Italian lady introducing the song but you can enjoy that! This song is kinda wild and I guess not for everyone but I love it. In the song, she is comparing her pussy to a vagina.

She is so cool and I love her style. She look so cute and beautiful in this music video. She produces her own music! It's all got this super cool breakbeat style and she's just giving popular girl at school vibes on top of it.
Happy halloween! Here's a spooky track that I love, the remix of Boo Lake from the DLC tracks of Mario Kart 8. Those drums are insane.
A super intense track from the Celeste's Farewell soundtrack. This was that part of the game with the blocks flicking in and out. I just really like it

There's more to this song than meets the eye. It's message: stay with your man even though it's bad! When I see the clip of her running in fear, it's giving domestic abuse. What's really going on, Kylie?
This song and video is extra, I love it. Shoutouts to Spellling for serving witchy magic music. It's so dramatic and I love her voice.
Beautiful song with an interesting structure that means a lot to me. This song was there for me when I was feeling feelings for a certain Mexican.
Beautiful track from a band I love. This version has added strings and trumpets which melts me. It's very Scandinavian
This song and video is everything. This band also made a website which inspired this one. I just want to be like her.
I listened to this music a lot because I completed all 50 levels. At first I hated it but now I love it. I feel very strongly towards it.
Insanely beautiful first level music from this 10/10 puzzle indie game. This is the music that got me to buy the game. It's just a taste of what awaits you when you also buy the game.
Classic track from my childhood. 'Lie down on the couch' is still something I say, also 'That boy needs therapy'. Video is fantastic too
Awesome cover of an obscure Depeche Mode song on this Norwegian TV show. I love it and I think Susanne SundfÃ¸r is great.
A beautiful and bewitching follow-up to 'City of Tears' with a stunning chord progression. Love it
The most outrageous bossa nova remix from the Mario Kart World team reimagining this classic from the DS era. I love the reharmonisation.
A beautiful song that I carry with me. It's about her, the moon, reflecting the light of her sun.
This is a wild track from a band who previous did bubblegum pop music. I love it. They said they wanted the song to be 'un-playlist-able' which it most definitely is.

dailysoundtracks.artist: Arata Iiyoshi, Keisuke Ito, Hideki Sakamoto
dailysoundtracks.album: Pokemon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Sky
dailysoundtracks.description: Huge vibe from this classic Pokemon game. Love the drums.
A song she did for a film 'Young Americans'. It's so dramatic and good. It should be the theme of a James Bond film.

One of my favourite ever songs. It's about Jens pretending to be the boyfriend of his friend Nina, who is using him to cover up her lesbian relationship. It's hilarious and lovely. And it has a follow-up! Check out 'the linden trees are still in blossom'

Expect a lot of Mario Kart World recommendations folks because this soundtrack is out of control. This is a remix of a pretty forgettable track from the Wii U but they made it slap so hard! Also, it's a rare track: it doesn't play on free roam, only on transitions between lava levels.
A beautiful track about documenting lovely moments. Stunning video as well!

dailysoundtracks.album: Paper Mario: The Thousand Year Door
dailysoundtracks.description: Today I'm celebrating this game's release on the Nintendo Music App with this absolute banger from the Gamecube. It's one of Nintendo's only dance bangers and who knows maybe it will find itself in a DJ World Peace set one day.

Welcome to the first soundtrack of the day! I'll use this space to recommend you some great music to enjoy every single day! Today I wanna highlight one of my all-time favourite artists Natalia and this song all about fucking off because she's had enough. Say no to screens, likes, annoying real-life shit and just go to the beach, get naked and swim in the sea and chat with the moon. The sigh right before the porrito reveal says it all.
